greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals: Fibonacci(k*n).
reference: R. L. Graham, D. E. Knuth and O. Patashnik, Concrete Mathematics. 2nd Edition. Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, 1994, p. 294.
formula: For prime p, the formula holds: Fibonacci(k*p) = Fibonacci(p) * Sum_{i=0..floor((k-1)/2)} C(k-i-1, i)*(-1)^(i*p+i)*Lucas(p)^(k-2i-1).
A(n, k) = F((n-1)*k)*F(k+1) + F((n-1)*k-1)*F(k), where F(n) = A000045(n). - _Freddy Barrera_, Jun 24 2019
program: [A(n, k) for d in (1..10) for n, k in zip((d..1, step=-1), (1..d))] # _Freddy Barrera_, Jun 24 2019
(MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[Fibonacci(k*(n-k+1)): k in [1..n]]: n in [1.. 15]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 04 2019
xref: Main diagonal is in A054783. Antidiagonal sums are in A102311.
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 06 2005
